member.name: LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY
member.summary: Returned from theFSCTL_LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER control code. Zero or more of these structures follow thestructure in the output buffer returned.

member.name: LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY.OffsetToNext
member.summary: Offset in bytes from the beginning of this structure to the nextLOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRYstructure returned. If there are no more entries, this value is zero.

summary.para: Flags describing characteristics about this stream. The value will consist of one or more of these values. At least one of the LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY_ATTRIBUTE_* values that fall within the LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY_ATTRIBUTE_MASK (0xff000000) will be set; one or more of the other flag values may be set.

listheader.description: The stream is part of the system pagefile.
The stream is locked from defragmentation. The HandleInfo member of the [MARK_HANDLE_INFO structure](ns-winioctl-mark_handle_info.md) for this stream has the MARK_HANDLE_PROTECT_CLUSTERS flag set.
The stream is part of a file that is internal to the filesystem.
The stream is part of a file that is internal to TxF.
The stream is part of a $DATA attribute for the file (data stream).
The stream is part of the $INDEX_ALLOCATION attribute for the file.
The stream is part of another attribute for the file.

member.name: LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY.Reserved
member.summary: This value is reserved and is currently zero.

member.name: LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY.Cluster
member.summary: This is the cluster that this entry refers to. It will be one of the clusters passed in the input structure.

member.name: LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY.FileName
member.summary: A NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the path of the object relative to the root of the volume. This string will refer to the attribute or stream represented by the cluster. This string is not limited by MAX_PATH and may be up to 32,768 characters (65,536 bytes) in length. Not all of the filenames returned can be opened; some are internal to NTFS and always opened exclusively. The string returned includes the full path including filename, stream name, and attribute type name in the form "full\path\to\file\filename.ext:streamname:typename".
